clinical_study.brief_title: Partial Wave Spectroscopic Detection of Colon Cancer Risk
clinical_study.official_title: Partial Wave Spectroscopic Detection of Colon Cancer Risk

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to study samples of rectal mucosa (the moist lining of the rectum) using a new light scattering technology, called partial wave spectroscopy (PWS) in patients who will undergo a standard of care colonoscopy or a flexible sigmoidoscopy and have a history of ulcerative colitis (UC).

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to study samples of rectal mucosa (the moist lining of the rectum) using a new light scattering technology, called partial wave spectroscopy (PWS)in patients who will undergo a colonoscopy or a flexible sigmoidoscopy and have a history of ulcerative colitis (UC). PWS has been recently developed to allow scientists to learn about any changes to the cells that may indicate a risk of developing colon cancer. We believe that the PWS test will more accurately detect the risk of colon cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: Study samples of rectal mucosa (the moist lining of the rectum) using PWS.
primary_outcome.description: Samples will be collected and then shipped to Northwestern University for analysis using PWS. This is to assess accuracy of detecting the risk for colon cancer.

arm_group.description: All subjects who are undergoing a standard of care colonoscopy for flexible sigmoidoscopy and have a history of UC and agree to participate will be in the main study group.

intervention.description: Partial wave spectroscopy (PWS)has been developed to allow scientists to learn about any changes to the cells that may indicate a risk of developing colon cancer.

biospec_descr.textblock: A sample of rectal mucosa will be collected during the subject's standard of care colonoscopy or flexible sigmoidoscopy.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects who are scheduled to undergo a standard of care flexible sigmoidoscopy or a colonoscopy and have a history of UC.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient must be 18 years old or older.
- Patient is already scheduled for a standard of care colonoscopy or flexible sigmoidoscopy.
- Patient has not received chemotherapy.
- History of ulcerative colitis.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient is unable to give informed consent..
- Patient has received chemo or radiation therapy within the past 3 months.
